document_title: Internal hemorrhoids: Signs, causes, treatment, what to eat and what to avoid?
subsection_name: benh-tri-noi.json_6_Diet for people with internal hemorrhoids
subsection_content:
In addition to avoiding sitting in one place for a long time; You should move and exercise every day; Avoid activities that put pressure on the anorectal area such as lifting heavy objects; Avoid straining when defecating or delaying defecation. People with internal hemorrhoids should have a diet as follows:
1. What should you eat if you have internal hemorrhoids?
People with internal hemorrhoids and hemorrhoids in general need a diet rich in fiber, including green vegetables, fruits and whole grains (note that when adding fiber, you need soluble and insoluble fiber). You should drink 2 liters of water every day and supplement foods rich in collagen and fat.
A diet rich in fiber helps prevent internal hemorrhoids
2. What should you avoid eating if you have internal hemorrhoids?
Hemorrhoid patients should avoid eating hot foods that lead to constipation, such as eating too many hot fruits such as longan and lychee; Spicy, hot, acrid foods; Avoid drinking alcohol, beer, coffee, bottled soft drinks...
